required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Risk of Bacterial Exposure to the Anesthesiologist's Face During Intubation and Extubation
clinical_study.official_title: Risk of Bacterial Exposure to the Anesthesiologist's Face During Intubation and Extubation

brief_summary.textblock: The practice of intubation and extubation is not without risks to the anesthesiologists. Especially, the face of health care worker is the body part most commonly contaminated by splashes and sprays of body fluids. The aim of this study is to determine the incidence of unrecognized exposure to the anesthesiologists' face during endotracheal intubation and extubation. We will perform face shield swab before and after the endotracheal intubation and extubation. All swabs will be cultured for 48 hours and the number of colony forming units before and after the procedures (intubation/extubation) will be compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Bacterial growth of face shield swab after the endotracheal extubation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Bacterial swab will be performed 5 minutes after the endotracheal extubation (after the confirmation of sufficient spontaneous breathing)
primary_outcome.description: All swab will be cultured for 48 hours and will be reported as no growth or by number of colony forming unit(CFU)s. The number of CFU of post-extubation swab will be compared with that of pre-extubation swab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bacterial growth of face shield swab after the endotracheal intubation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Bacterial swab will be performed 5 minutes after the endotracheal extubation (after the confirmation of adequate mechanical ventilation)
secondary_outcome.description: All swab will be cultured for 48 hours and will be reported as no growth or by number of colony forming unit(CFU)s. The number of CFU of post-intubation swab will be compared with that of pre-intubation swab.

clinical_study.condition: Anesthesiologists Who Perform Endotracheal Intubation and Extubation

arm_group.arm_group_label: anesthesiologists who will perform endotracheal intubation and extubation for general anesthesia
arm_group.description: All anesthesiologists in this study will use face shield for facial protection. Face shield swab will be done before and after the procedures (intubation and extubation)

study_pop.textblock: All anesthesiologists who perform endotracheal intubation and extubation will be included in this study. This study will be done only in patients who are scheduled for endotracheal intubation for elective surgeries.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- anesthesiologists who perform endotracheal intubation and extubation for patients scheduled for endotracheal intubation for elective surgeries
Exclusion Criteria:
- none

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine Yonsei University College of Medicine
